passages.name: PLAY AGAIN
passages.text:
LET'S ROB A BANK
the choice-based simulator game

by bethany nolan

[[BEGIN]]

passages.name: BEGIN
passages.text:
THE BANK:


Richman's Circle Bank is in the centre of London, set on a busy road, next to a café (Terry's Tea) and a hair salon (Snips).

Your surveillance of the building has told you the following:

There is only one guard, stationed at the front door.

On an average Tuesday, about noon, there's approximately eleven customers inside and two staff workers behind the counter.

There is no bulletproof glass between the customers and the staff.

There are five cameras inside the building and one ATM out front.


[[CHOOSE YOUR TEAM]]

passages.text:
CHOOSE YOUR TEAM


MASTERMIND: YOU
[[DIVERSION]]
GETAWAY DRIVER
MUSCLE

passages.name: DIVERSION
passages.text:
YOUR OPTIONS FOR THE DIVERSION:

NAME: [[AMY HAWKINS]]
PROS: Actress that can fake any medical emergency - heart attack, stroke, limb-dismemberment (with some prep).
CONS: Wants 40% of the cut.

NAME: [[FRANCIS EZIKIEL]]
PROS: Demolitions expert with little regard for human life.
CONS: Racist. Requires half payment up front due to high risk.

NAME: [[RANDALL STAUNTON]]
PROS: Is willing to make an ass of themselves and yell at cashiers at the window over fraud, or some other finance-related problem, diverting all attention to themselves.
CONS: Narcoleptic.

CONS: Superstitious about the music playing on the radio.

CONS: Doesn't speak.

CONS: Is 4"2'.

passages.name: CONTINUE
passages.text:
It’s Wednesday, February 19th, 11:42AM.

Your car pulls up across the street from Richman’s Circle; a  red BMW, freshly cleaned. Rex had a guy to supply it. It'll be ditched as soon as you're done here. A shame, really.

You sit in the passenger seat and look out to the bank. It looks the same as it did every day you checked it out. You never went inside; you had people for that.

In the back seat sits Big Jerry. He glowers at Rex.

"You're not gonna drive like that when we leave, right?"

Rex frowns, immediately defensive. "What's wrong with my driving?"

"Other than my eighty-year-old Nana could do better-"

"Hey! If you wanna drive-"

"-and she's half blind and can't use both hands-"

Rex raises his voice: "I said if you wanna drive!"

[[CUT IN]]
[[LET THEM ARGUE]]
[[QUIT, BECAUSE YOUR MAMA SAID TEAM WORK IS KEY AND THIS TEAM AIN'T WORKING]]

[[GO INSIDE->go1]]

passages.name: con9
passages.text:
It’s Wednesday, February 19th, 11:42AM.

Your car pulls up across the street from Richman’s Circle; a vibrant blue Mercedes that was blasting music from the speakers long before you climbed inside. The driver, Hayley O'Ryan, sings as she drives.

You sit in the passenger seat and look out to the bank. It looks the same as it did every day you checked it out. You never went inside; you had people for that.

Just as you are about to wave Big Jerry out of the car, Hayley stops you.

"Wait," she says, and reaches for the stereo. She spends a moment turning through the channels, frowning through each one; the crease in her brow growing deeper as she finds song after song she doesn't like. "This doesn't bode well," she mutters.

Then, she stops, a hesitant smile on her face.

There is low bass playing out of the speaker and she sits back, nodding to you. She points for you to climb out just as the guitars kick in, and you do.

CONS: Is 4"2'.

passages.name: con54
passages.text:
It’s Wednesday, February 19th, 11:42AM.

Your car pulls up across the street from Richman’s Circle; a  red BMW, freshly cleaned. Rex had a guy to supply it. It'll be ditched as soon as you're done here. A shame, really.

You sit in the passenger seat and look out to the bank. It looks the same as it did every day you checked it out. You never went inside; you had people for that.

Today, however, is going to be different.

[[GO INSIDE->go4]]

passages.name: con55
passages.text:
It’s Wednesday, February 19th, 11:42AM.

Your car pulls up across the street from Richman’s Circle; a  red BMW, freshly cleaned. Rex had a guy to supply it. It'll be ditched as soon as you're done here. A shame, really.

You sit in the passenger seat and look out to the bank. It looks the same as it did every day you checked it out. You never went inside; you had people for that.

In the back seat sits Big Jerry. He glowers at Rex.

"You're not gonna drive like that when we leave, right?"

Rex frowns, immediately defensive. "What's wrong with my driving?"

"Other than my eighty-year-old Nana could do better-"

"Hey! If you wanna drive-"

"-and she's half blind and can't use both hands-"

Rex raises his voice: "I said if you wanna drive!"

[[GO INSIDE->go5]]

passages.name: con63
passages.text:
It’s Wednesday, February 19th, 11:42AM.

Your car pulls up across the street from Richman’s Circle; a vibrant blue Mercedes that was blasting music from the speakers long before you climbed inside. The driver, Hayley O'Ryan, sings as she drives.

You sit in the passenger seat and look out to the bank. It looks the same as it did every day you checked it out. You never went inside; you had people for that.

Just as you are about to wave Big Jerry out of the car, Hayley stops you.

"Wait," she says, and reaches for the stereo. She spends a moment turning through the channels, frowning through each one; the crease in her brow growing deeper as she finds song after song she doesn't like. "This doesn't bode well," she mutters.

She stops tuning, a grim frown across her face. "We shouldn't do this."

"Bullshit," you say. "Let's go."

You leave her in the car. She doesn't look happy.

[[GO INSIDE->go21]]

passages.name: con64
passages.text:
It’s Wednesday, February 19th, 11:42AM.

You sit in the passenger seat and look out to the bank. It looks the same as it did every day you checked it out. You never went inside; you had people for that.

Just as you are about to wave The Destroyer out of the car, Hayley stops you.

"Wait," she says, and reaches for the stereo. She spends a moment turning through the channels, frowning through each one; the crease in her brow growing deeper as she finds song after song she doesn't like. "This doesn't bode well," she mutters.

Then, she stops, a hesitant smile on her face.

There is low bass playing out of the speaker and she sits back, nodding to you. She points for you to climb out just as the guitars kick in, and you do.

passages.name: con72
passages.text:
It’s Wednesday, February 19th, 11:42AM.

Your car pulls up across the street from Richman’s Circle; a black McLaren that looks as if it's seen better days. From the moment you climbed inside, the car is dead silent.

You sit in the passenger seat and look out to the bank. It looks the same as it did every day you checked it out. You never went inside; you had people for that.

Today, however, is going to be different.

"Keep the engine running," you tell "Orange". "And don't fuck up like you did on the last job."

The look he sends you could kill a man. You get out of the car quickly to escape it.

passages.name: CUT IN
passages.text:
"HEY!" You shout. "Shut up or go home. I'm not a babysitter."

The two fall silent.

Then, Rex mumbles: "let's see you drive us from the police."

"Let's see you lift five-hundred pounds," Big Jerry shoots back.

"CUT IT OUT," you order. They're silent again.

[["Good, let's do this."]]

passages.name: LET THEM ARGUE
passages.text:
"You know what-" Rex turns in his seat to glare at Big Jerry.

"What?"

"How about I ditch this shitshow and you can run home from the cops on those stumpy lil' legs of yours?"

"What did you just say?" Big Jerry has hellfire in his eyes and you don't like it.

"I said-"

[["CUT IT OUT"]]
[[QUIT, BECAUSE YOUR MAMA SAID TEAM WORK IS KEY AND THIS TEAM AIN'T WORKING]]

passages.name: QUIT, BECAUSE YOUR MAMA SAID TEAM WORK IS KEY AND THIS TEAM AIN'T WORKING
passages.text:
You're done.

The gig is over. What a shitshow.

You head back to your hideout and stare at all the research you conducted, wasted and pasted to the wall. All that work for nothing.

You turn to your computer. 

Time to find another target.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(And maybe succeed this time?)

Right on time, an explosion sounds, distant - just a thud. You feel the rumble, though, faint. The guard rushes out of the bank, to search for the smoke, and in that moment you and The Destroyer slip by his side and into the bank.

passages.name: KEEP GOING
passages.text:
As you enter, The Destroyer keeps shooting. One after another, the customers fall to their knees, blood painting the walls and their bodies thumping, slack, to the ground.

He stops short of the cashier, splattered with blood and screaming. She's kneelng over the body of a woman that you recognise immediately, also half drenched in red. Amy Hawkins watches The Destroyer with a raised eyebrow.

"You didn't even let me finish," she says, sitting up. Amy, covered half in fake blood, half in real, pulls the fake arm out from her sleeve - a nasty, false gash still pumping red liquid. "What was even the point of hiring me?"

You throw a pistol to her from your suitcase, and pull out another for yourself to point at the cashier.

"He's a little trigger happy," you reply, nodding to The Destroyer, who is now surveying his destruction. "You two, watch the doors. Yell if the police arrive. You," you look at the cashier, quivering where she sits, "take me to the vault."

[[THE VAULT]]

passages.name: keep3
passages.text:
As you enter the bank, The Destroyer pulls his gun from the suitcase and shoots the guard in the head.

Brain matter splatters on the wall behind him.

You check the time on your watch: three minutes until detonation.

"THIS IS A ROBBERY," you shout, "PUT YOUR HANDS IN THE AIR AND GET ON THE GROUND!"

You speed over to the cashiers, producing a bag from your suitcase. "Money in the bag, now."

They're hesitant, so The Destroyer shoots one.

The other gets to work.

You look out across the clientele and nod over to The Destroyer.

[["TAKE THEIR JEWELLERY, WATCHES - WHATEVER"]]

passages.name: keep6
passages.text:
Spinning with the rifle in hand, you shout.

"ON THE GROUND! THIS IS A ROBBERY!"

The Destroyer already has weapons pointed at the two cashiers, and you point yours towards the guard, who's struggling between holding onto Randall and following orders.

"Money," The Destroyer tells the cashiers. "In the case. Go."

Randall pulls himself from the guard and stands.

"You got one of those for me?" he asks, and you nod back to The Destroyer. Randall heads off and you watch the guard; watch how his fingers twitch.

His hand is moving slowly, in almost microscopic amounts, towards his radio.

[[NOT TODAY, BUDDY]]

Or, maybe, the second coming of Christ happens. 

Or, North Korea finally nukes everyone. (Alternatively, Donald Trump pretends he's going to push the //NUKE EVERYONE// button, with the aim of making Congress shit themselves, and then accidentally leans on it as he tries to reach his Diet Coke.)

Either way, the Earth suddenly doesn't exist anymore and so we will never know if you manage to rob this bank because it's gone, too.

You and Big Jerry head over to the counter, barging past the queue as you go. Big Jerry pushes aside whoever was first in line, and you lean against the counter.

"Hi," you say. "This is a robbery. Please keep your hands where I can see them and give me all the money in your till."

The woman freezes.

"If you don't, I'll kill you."

She doesn't move, so you shrug.

passages.text:

Some customers scream; lowering themselves to the ground on command. Some are more hesitant and you point your guns towards them, waving them around wildly until they get the message.

There's a bag in your suitcase for the money.

passages.name: ASK AGAIN
passages.text:
"Vault," you order, louder, and she's on her feet a heartbeat later, nodding her head. "Quick about it."

You tell Big Jerry to look after the hostages and, keeping your pistol raised, follow the cashier through.

At the first door, she says, "I need to put in a code."

"Go on."

She presses at the buttons until a light turns green and you're through the first door, heading back into an office area where you lodge the barrel of the gun into the small of her back to force her forward.

"Okay, okay." She takes you through another door and down a flight of stairs until you're faced with a circular door of steel. A keypad and card reader on the right, and a locking wheel in the centre of the door.

She looks to you for confirmation and you shove her forward. She presses in a code, swipes her card and turns the wheel.

[[THE VAULT OPENS]]

passages.name: SHOOT HER AND TRY SOMEONE ELSE
passages.text:
You roll your eyes.

"Fine."

You put a bullet in her skull and move to the next.

[[THE OTHER CASHIER->ASK AGAIN]]

passages.name: THE VAULT OPENS
passages.text:
Past the door there's a small room, grey in colour.

In the centre is a metallic pallet, piled high with clean, new bank notes.

[[STUFF AS MUCH AS YOU CAN INTO YOUR BAG]]
[[GET THE CASHIER TO DO IT]]

links.text: STUFF AS MUCH AS YOU CAN INTO YOUR BAG

destination.name: STUFF AS MUCH AS YOU CAN INTO YOUR BAG

links.text: GET THE CASHIER TO DO IT

destination.name: GET THE CASHIER TO DO IT

passages.name: STUFF AS MUCH AS YOU CAN INTO YOUR BAG
passages.text:
You step into the room and, in a scramble, start shoving the money into your bag. Hundreds, thousands of pounds passing through your hands. So much of it.

This is the big leagues.

This is what you've been planning for.

Then, there's a sudden pain in your back and the air leaves your lungs. You fall to one knee, and turn around, where the cashier is holding a fire extinguisher ahead of her, ready to hit you again.

[[SHOOT HER]]
[[FIGHT HER IN THE HONOURABLE SPORT OF HAND-TO-HAND COMBAT]]

links.text: FIGHT HER IN THE HONOURABLE SPORT OF HAND-TO-HAND COMBAT

destination.name: FIGHT HER IN THE HONOURABLE SPORT OF HAND-TO-HAND COMBAT

passages.name: GET THE CASHIER TO DO IT
passages.text:
You shove her into the room and force the bag into her hands.

"Fill it," you order, and so she does, shaking as she goes. She stuffs the wads of notes into the bag; hundreds, thousands of pounds passing through her hands. So much of it.

This is the big leagues.

This is what you've been planning for.

When she's done, she hands the bag back.

[[SMILE AND SHOOT HER]]

passages.name: SHOOT HER
passages.text:
The blood splatters back at you.

She drops the fire extinguisher and the sound of it hitting the floor echoes around the room.

There's a pain in your back and you keep filling your bag with money.

[[GO BACK UPSTAIRS]]

passages.name: FIGHT HER IN THE HONOURABLE SPORT OF HAND-TO-HAND COMBAT
passages.text:
Man, you haven't fought like this in a while. It feels good.

You yank the extinguisher from her feeble grip and throw it to the side, dropping your gun and bag to the floor as you go. You punch her straight in the face and she stumbles back, blood spurting from her nose.

As she steps back, you step forward, into her space, grabbing her hair and slamming her head against the vault's door frame. She goes limp in your hands, unconscious most likely, and you drop her to the floor.

A small part of you wishes she'd been a better fighter. You could do with a challenge - but there's no time for that in this job. You've already spent too long down here.

[[FILL YOUR BAG AND GO BACK UPSTAIRS]]

links.text: FILL YOUR BAG AND GO BACK UPSTAIRS

destination.name: FILL YOUR BAG AND GO BACK UPSTAIRS

passages.name: GO BACK UPSTAIRS
passages.text:
Upstairs, the hostages are lying on the floor, still shaking and crying and pleading quietly.

You head straight past them, to where Big Jerry stands with his semi-automatic. Amy Hawkins stands next to him, toting a gun from your suitcase.

Faintly, in the distance, you can hear the sirens of the police, copping onto the robbery. There must've been a silent alarm somewhere. Or maybe someone outside phoned.

Either way,

[[YOU'RE OUTTA HERE]]

[[RUN AS FAST AS YOUR LEGS CAN CARRY YOU->run]]

links.text: RUN AS FAST AS YOUR LEGS CAN CARRY YOU

passages.name: HOTWIRE THE CAR
passages.text:
You leap into the driver's seat, the car keys missing.

You swear Rex out as you search for the wires under the steering wheel.

"Boss," Big Jerry interjects. "The little shit slashed the tyres."

You stop, slam your hand against the horn, and jump out from the car.

[[RUN AS FAST AS YOUR LEGS CAN CARRY YOU]]

links.text: RUN AS FAST AS YOUR LEGS CAN CARRY YOU

destination.name: RUN AS FAST AS YOUR LEGS CAN CARRY YOU

passages.name: RUN AS FAST AS YOUR LEGS CAN CARRY YOU
passages.text:
Your feet pound against the pavement as you sprint down the street, gun in one hand, bag of cash in the other. Big Jerry and Amy are right on your heel as you go; the three of you barrelling through busy city streets.

The sirens are close, closer - they're right behind you and so loud.

Ahead of you, there are flashing lights and you swerve, heading down a side road.

Your back is still killing from the hit of the fire extinguisher, and you're furious at Rex for leaving, and ahead of you the empty road is filling with blue lights and the sound of sirens.

A cop leaps from the car, gun in hand and promptly ducks away when Amy fires on him.

You turn to run back, but there's a car there, too.

//Shit.// Three police - four, now - all with guns pointed straight at you.

"DROP THE GUNS!"

"PUT YOUR HANDS IN THE AIR!"

"GET ON THE GROUND"

[[THROUGH THE WINDSCREEN, YOU SEE A NOTE->note2]]

links.text: THROUGH THE WINDSCREEN, YOU SEE A NOTE

passages.name: ask
passages.text:
"MONEY IN THE BAG. NOW," you shout, thrusting the bag toward her.

She scrambles up, opening the cash drawer in the counter. Her fingers shake as she pulls the notes out.

"Not the bottom ones," you say. The bottom ones might be bugged. Or covered in that blue paint that your dry cleaner refuses to clean. "I know that trick."

She nods, pulling out the money and shoving it into your waiting bag.

Behind you, Amy Hawkins climbs to her feet, having faked some medical emergency well enough, and takes a gun from the suitcase.

You and the cashier move to the next till and empty that one, too.

When she's done, you smile at her.

"Thanks," you say.

[[THEN YOU SHOOT HER]]

passages.name: else
passages.text:
You roll your eyes.

"Fine."

You put a bullet in her skull and move to the next.

passages.name: run2
passages.text:
Your feet pound against the pavement as you sprint down the street, gun in one hand, bag of cash in the other. Big Jerry and Amy are right on your heel as you go; the three of you barrelling through busy city streets.

You get a decent distance before the sirens begin to close in.

"There!" Amy shouts, pointing to a car where a woman is climbing out.

The three of you rush over, Big Jerry shoving her out the way and jumping into her driver's seat.

You leap in the passenger side and Amy into the back. Big Jerry speeds the car away from the side of the road, and starts out onto the road. But the sirens are too close for this - you can see the flashing blue lights up ahead.

"Where's Rex?" Amy yells as Big Jerry swerves onto another road.

"Big Jerry made him quit!" You shout back. Big Jerry shouldn't have done that.

"He was a shit driver!"

"Better than you!" Amy says.

Then the police cars are ahead of you, behind you. They're everywhere and to give Rex credit - he would've been able to get you out of this. Big Jerry isn't the driver Rex is and he skids to a halt, rolling down the window and shooting his gun at the nearest cop car.

But you're surrounded. You shoot while you can, but the bullets run out, and the police are coming in full force.

"DROP THE GUNS!"

"PUT YOUR HANDS IN THE AIR!"

"GET OUT OF THE CAR!"

She doesn't move; just stares at you silently, shaking.

passages.name: ask5
passages.text:
"Vault," you order, louder, and she's on her feet a heartbeat later, nodding her head. "Quick about it."

You tell Big Jerry to look after the hostages and, keeping your pistol raised, follow the cashier through.

At the first door, she says, "I need to put in a code."

"Go on."

She presses at the buttons until a light turns green and you're through the first door, heading back into an office area where you lodge the barrel of the gun into the small of her back to force her forward.

"Okay, okay." She takes you through another door and down a flight of stairs until you're faced with a circular door of steel. A keypad and card reader on the right, and a locking wheel in the centre of the door.

She looks to you for confirmation and you shove her forward. She presses in a code, swipes her card and turns the wheel.

passages.name: stuff
passages.text:
You step into the room and, in a scramble, start shoving the money into your bag. Hundreds, thousands of pounds passing through your hands. So much of it.

This is the big leagues.

This is what you've been planning for.

Then, there's a sudden pain in your back and the air leaves your lungs. You fall to one knee, and turn around, where the cashier is holding a fire extinguisher ahead of her, ready to hit you again.

passages.name: outta4
passages.text:
Out on the street, the people who catch sight of you and your guns gasp and scream and run the other way.

You sprint across the road to the car, where Hayley is waiting. You can hear the music; see how she cracks her knuckles right before you throw yourself into the front of the car.

Amy and Big Jerry are in the back, and Hayley's off, the engine screaming as she goes.

She's two roads away before you hear the sirens, but she doesn't react to them, just speeds away, swerving dangerously around corners, and weaving herself through the traffic.

As the first police car comes into view far behind us, the song ends and a new one turns on. It's slower, and you see Hayley's gaze flit between the road and the stereo.

Someone starts singing about a break up.

"Change the song," she says.

"What?" Big Jerry asks. "Forget the music! Just drive!"

"Change the song!" she repeats, her voice loud this time.

[[CHANGE THE SONG]]
[[SAY NO]]

passages.name: outta5
passages.text:
Out on the street, the people who catch sight of you and your guns gasp and scream and run the other way.

You sprint across the road to the car, where "Orange" is already moving the car. You throw yourself into the vehicle, and he speeds off, weaving in and out of traffic, passing through side roads and heading as far from the sirens as he can.

It's the easiest getaway you've ever had.

Amy leans forward from the back. "When do I get my money?"

"When we're safe," you say.

"Can't wait for my 25%," Big Jerry says, lowering his bandana.

Amy scoffs. "Can't wait for my //40//."

There's silence for just a moment, and you see a dark look from "Orange" sent towards you.

"You're getting 40%?" Big Jerry asks.

And then it's loud. Then there's arguing and too many words flying over one another, and you have no chance to help because there's shouting and then there's a gunshot.

You spin around, watching as Big Jerry leans over Amy's bleeding body and, just as "Orange" takes you around a corner, opens the door and shoves her out onto the road.

You watch her body roll.

passages.name: ask8
passages.text:
"MONEY IN THE BAG. NOW," you shout, thrusting the bag toward her.

She scrambles up, opening the cash drawer in the counter. Her fingers shake as she pulls the notes out.

"Not the bottom ones," you say. The bottom ones might be bugged. Or covered in that blue paint that your dry cleaner refuses to clean. "I know that trick."

She nods, pulling out the money and shoving it into your waiting bag.

Behind you, Amy Hawkins climbs to her feet, having faked some medical emergency well enough, and takes a gun from the suitcase.

You and the cashier move to the next till and empty that one, too.

When she's done, you smile at her.

"Thanks," you say.

[[THEN YOU SHOOT HER->then2]]

passages.name: else8
passages.text:
You roll your eyes.

"Fine."

You put a bullet in her skull and move to the next.

[[THE OTHER CASHIER->ask8]]

passages.name: then
passages.text:
Out on the street, the people who catch sight of you and your guns gasp and scream and run the other way.

You sprint across the road to the car, where Hayley is waiting. You can hear the music; see how she cracks her knuckles right before you throw yourself into the front of the car.

Amy and Big Jerry are in the back, and Hayley's off, the engine screaming as she goes.

She's two roads away before you hear the sirens, but she doesn't react to them, just speeds away, swerving dangerously around corners, and weaving herself through the traffic.

As the first police car comes into view far behind us, the song ends and a new one turns on. It's slower, and you see Hayley's gaze flit between the road and the stereo.

Someone starts singing about a break up.

"Change the song," she says.

"What?" Big Jerry asks. "Forget the music! Just drive!"

"Change the song!" she repeats, her voice loud this time.

[[CHANGE THE SONG]]
[[SAY NO]]

passages.name: then2
passages.text:
Out on the street, the people who catch sight of you and your guns gasp and scream and run the other way.

You sprint across the road to the car, where "Orange" is already moving the car. You throw yourself into the vehicle, and he speeds off, weaving in and out of traffic, passing through side roads and heading as far from the sirens as he can.

It's the easiest getaway you've ever had.

Amy leans forward from the back. "When do I get my money?"

"When we're safe," you say.

"Can't wait for my 25%," Big Jerry says, lowering his bandana.

Amy scoffs. "Can't wait for my //40//."

There's silence for just a moment, and you see a dark look from "Orange" sent towards you.

"You're getting 40%?" Big Jerry asks.

And then it's loud. Then there's arguing and too many words flying over one another, and you have no chance to help because there's shouting and then when you look around, there's Big Jerry, pulling out his gun.

[[SHOOT BIG JERRY]]
[[SHOOT AMY]]

passages.name: CHANGE THE SONG
passages.text:
You lean forward and change the song over until you see something you recognise. It has a fast beat to it.

You look over at Hayley, who nods, and you're flung back against the door as she skids around a lorry, onto a tiny side street. The police car, far behind us, can't make the turn and continues on.

Big Jerry swears and shakes his head, but you don't pay attention to him. Keeping your driver happy is important, especially if they're your only escape.

[[JUST DRIVE]]

passages.name: SAY NO
passages.text:
"No! Just drive, O'Ryan! Forget the song!"

Hayley's frown deepens, but she keeps driving. She speeds through the streets, swerving around corners and losing the police at every turn, only for more cars to appear from another road.

You know there's too many of them. Too many cop cars, too many civilian cars. Mistakes were littered in your perfectly laid plan.

Hayley skids the car to a halt when she hits a line of traffic.

"Out the car!" you yell, gripping the bag of money tightly as you leap from the vehicle.

"Should've changed the song," Hayley complains as you begin to run. But there are police everywhere, loaded guns pointing at you.

Big Jerry shoots at them and you duck behind a car for cover. But it's a losing battle, and the police shoot back - you watch Big Jerry's body fall to the ground and swear.

"LOWER YOUR WEAPONS!"

"GET ON THE GROUND!"

[[COMPLY, FACE YOUR DEFEAT]]
[[YOU'D RATHER DIE THAN BE CAPTURED]]

links.text: YOU'D RATHER DIE THAN BE CAPTURED

destination.name: YOU'D RATHER DIE THAN BE CAPTURED

passages.name: change
passages.text:
You lean forward and change the song over until you see something you recognise. It has a fast beat to it.

You look over at Hayley, who nods, and you're flung back against the door as she skids around a lorry, onto a tiny side street. The police car, far behind you, can't make the turn and continues on.

Big Jerry swears and shakes his head, but you don't pay attention to him. Keeping your driver happy is important, especially if they're your only escape.

Coming out from that street, there's another police car, flashing blue and racing towards you.

Hayley darts out onto the road, the Merc speeding away, but the police car - now two, three of them - is catching.

[[SHOOT AT THE POLICE]]
[[DON'T SHOOT]]

links.text: YOU'D RATHER DIE THAN BE CAPTURED

destination.name: YOU'D RATHER DIE THAN BE CAPTURED

passages.name: JUST DRIVE
passages.text:
She drives.

And drives.

And drives.

You reach an underground car park and switch cars. You're in the driver's seat, Hayley next to you. Amy and Big Jerry take the other car. You take off your bandana.

The police are searching for a blue Mercedes.

You drive a red Fiat Punto.

You're home free.

[[STATS->stats4]]

passages.name: SHOOT AT THE POLICE
passages.text:
You lower the window and shoot at the police, catching a few as you go. Bullets rain down on the Mercedes, breaking the windows. Hayley swerves the car away from the intitial storm, but there's a second - the police are closing in from all sides.

Then you feel the splatter of blood against your skin.

The Mercedes crashes into a parked car at the side of the road, and you look over to Hayley, finding her slumped with a deep, red hole in her temple.

In this pause, the police advance.

"GET OUT OF THE CAR!"

"PUT DOWN YOUR WEAPONS!"

[[COMPLY WITH THE PO-PO]]
[[NEVER! HAYLEY'S DEATH WILL NOT BE IN VAIN!]]

links.text: NEVER! HAYLEY'S DEATH WILL NOT BE IN VAIN!

destination.name: NEVER! HAYLEY'S DEATH WILL NOT BE IN VAIN!

passages.name: DON'T SHOOT
passages.text:
Hayley keeps driving, but the world is against you. The police block every road - there are guns drawn everywhere, and you don't shoot at them.

They'll start shooting if you do.

"GET OUT OF THE CAR!"

"LOWER YOUR WEAPONS!"

[[COMPLY, YOU SORRY EXCUSE FOR A CRIMINAL]]

links.text: COMPLY, YOU SORRY EXCUSE FOR A CRIMINAL

destination.name: COMPLY, YOU SORRY EXCUSE FOR A CRIMINAL

passages.name: COMPLY, FACE YOUR DEFEAT

[[STATS->stats3]]

passages.name: YOU'D RATHER DIE THAN BE CAPTURED
passages.text:
Idiot.

You shoot and shoot and shoot and get shot at in return. You were asking for it really.

You bleed out on the street, and your last sight is of Amy, raising her hands above her head and Hayley, ducking behind another car and running as fast as her legs can carry her.

[[STATS->stats2]]

[[AFTERMATH->aftermath2]]

passages.name: aftermath2
passages.text:
No one comes to your funeral. You let your criminal life replace your family and friends.

Hayley O'Ryan is as good a get-away runner as she is a driver and evades capture.

You should've changed the music.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Don't die this time.)

passages.name: aftermath3
passages.text:
Big Jerry has a funeral, but you don't go. You wouldn't if you weren't in prison, anyway.

You weren't those kind of friends.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Do better next time, okay?)

You start planning your next heist in the back of your mind.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Can you rob this bank again?)

passages.text:
Ducking, you try to escape the car, but there's gunfire everywhere - gunfire you caused. Amy and Big Jerry try to follow you out but the bullets are breaking their skin, slicing into their bodies.

And then one hits you, and its like no pain you've felt before.

Another.

One in the chest.

And then, you're in darkness.

You're not surprised.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Don't kill Hayley next time, got it?)

passages.name: aftermath5
passages.text:
You're not a fan of prison. The food isn't great. Your cellmate is nice though - but they're a four-time murderer, so you sleep with one eye open.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(You can do better than that.)

passages.name: stats7
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: TWO

[[CONGRATS->congrats2]]

passages.name: congrats2
passages.text:
After a lot of arguing with Big Jerry, and a lot of evil glares from "Orange", you get your even third of the money.

Big Jerry, however, is a named wanted man after his face was caught on camera as he shoved Amy's body out of the car.

At Amy's funeral, you watched from afar as her coffin was lowered into the ground.

You get the feeling that Big Jerry might be watching, too.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Good job, I guess. Can you do better?)

passages.name: SHOOT BIG JERRY
passages.text:
You shoot Big Jerry before he has a chance to shoot Amy. You look away, back to where "Orange" is driving, so you don't have to look at his body.

"Thank you," Amy says, quiet.

"Orange" doesn't speak.

He keeps driving, and soon the sirens are catching up, and police are blocking roads and "Orange" never was the most loyal, you suppose, because when he stops the car at last, no road left to drive, he leaps out immedaitely and runs off down a side street.

You cock your gun, watching as a few of the police chase him on foot.

"We make it out of this," you say to Amy, "you can have 50%."

Amy lifts Big Jerry's gun - the semi-automatic.

It's a pipe dream. There are too many of them compared to the two of you.

"LOWER YOUR WEAPONS!" The police shout.

"Let's earn our reward," Amy says.

[[GO DOWN FIGHTING]]

passages.name: SHOOT AMY
passages.text:
You shoot Amy before Big Jerry has the chance to even threaten her with it. Her head snaps back against the headrest before she slumps forward.

Blood splatters against the back window.

Big Jerry stares at you, wide-eyed. "Orange" takes his eyes off the road for a moment too long as he watches you, and has to swerve to avoid collision with another car.

"She isn't getting a higher cut anymore," you say, though maybe you just killed her so Big Jerry couldn't have the satisfaction. You're not sure.

"I'll dump the body," Big Jerry says, leaning across her to her door.

"Don't," you reply. "We'll bury her ourselves."

You take a long look at her body.

[["ORANGE" KEEPS DRIVING->stats8]]

passages.name: stats8
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

passages.text:

You count out the money and when Big Jerry comes to collect, you give him less than a third. It's his fault Amy's dead, anyway.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(In some ending, Amy lives. Try to find it.)

"This is a robbery!" You announce, turning and waving your gun around. "Please remain calm and we won't have to kill you!" You look to the remaining cashier, who's quivering where she stands. "Money. Bag. Now."

She starts unloading notes into the bag and you watch, smiling.

Big Jerry totes his gun around the room as he looks over the customers, occasionally taking their jewellery or, in some cases, the money from their bags.

"Wonderful," you say, taking the bag when she's done.

Then you shoot her.

[["HEY!" SOMEONE SHOUTS]]

"This is a robbery!" You announce, turning and waving your gun around. "Please remain calm and we won't have to kill you!" You look to the remaining cashier, who's quivering where she stands. "Money. Bag. Now."

passages.text:

You don't see a gun.

[[SHOOT HIM]]
[[SHOOT A HOSTAGE AS A POWER MOVE]]

links.text: SHOOT A HOSTAGE AS A POWER MOVE

destination.name: SHOOT A HOSTAGE AS A POWER MOVE

passages.name: SHOOT HIM
passages.text:
In three shots, he's on the ground and you're running out the door, bag in hand, Big Jerry on your tail.

Out front, you see the car, flashy and red.

But there isn't a driver.

[[THERE IS, HOWEVER, A NOTE IN THE WINDOW]]

links.text: THERE IS, HOWEVER, A NOTE IN THE WINDOW

destination.name: THERE IS, HOWEVER, A NOTE IN THE WINDOW

passages.name: SHOOT A HOSTAGE AS A POWER MOVE
passages.text:
You shoot the nearest civilian and she screams, blood spurting from a fresh wound. She falls to her knees and someone bends down to help her.

"Don't move," Big Jerry says. "Or the next one's going in you."

They freeze and you turn back to the guard.

"Or," you say, "the next bullet could go in you. Out the way."

He pauses before going slack. He moves aside.

You and Big Jerry head for the door.

[[SHOOT THE GUARD ANYWAY]]

passages.name: THERE IS, HOWEVER, A NOTE IN THE WINDOW
passages.text:
//YOU WANTED TO DRIVE, ASSHOLE//

[[OH SHIT]]

passages.name: OH SHIT
passages.text:
"That piece of shit," Big Jerry says.

"Indeed," you reply.

You have a few seconds. The bomb will distract for only a minute. The bomb won't attract every cop car.

[[HOTWIRE THE CAR->hotwire3]]
[[STEAL A CAR]]

passages.name: SHOOT THE GUARD ANYWAY
passages.text:

But there isn't a driver.

[[THERE IS, HOWEVER, A NOTE IN THE WINDOW]]

links.text: THERE IS, HOWEVER, A NOTE IN THE WINDOW

destination.name: THERE IS, HOWEVER, A NOTE IN THE WINDOW

passages.name: STEAL A CAR
passages.text:
You run back out into the centre of the road and a car skids to a halt ahead of you. You point your gun at the driver, running around to their door.

"Get out the car!"

Big Jerry runs to the passenger side, pulls it open and yanks the passenger out.

The driver's side door opens and the man sitting there climbs out, asking you not to shoot. You shove him aside and jump into his car, accelerating away before Big Jerry even shuts his door.

You do well for a minute. You drive dangerously, recklessly; weaving in and out of the traffic - but you're no Rex. You're no getaway driver.

When the police cars come, and they do, you can't swerve like Rex - you can't evade capture, can't perform 180-degree turns, can't mislead the cops like him.

So, eventually, you reach their blockade and skid to a stop.

Big Jerry looks at you from the passenger seat.

"I got a daughter," he tells you, "and it's gonna be your fault if I don't get to see her for the next ten years."

Though, really, you think it's his.

[[LEAVE THE CAR WITH YOUR HANDS UP]]

links.text: LEAVE THE CAR WITH YOUR HANDS UP

destination.name: LEAVE THE CAR WITH YOUR HANDS UP

passages.name: hotwire3
passages.text:
You leap into the driver's seat, the car keys missing.

You swear Rex out as you search for the wires under the steering wheel.

"Boss," Big Jerry interjects. "The little shit slashed the tyres."

You stop, slam your hand against the horn, and jump out from the car.

[[RUN]]

passages.name: RUN
passages.text:
Your feet pound against the pavement as you sprint down the street, gun in one hand, bag of cash in the other. Big Jerry is right on your heel as you go; the two of you barrelling through busy city streets.

The sirens shouldn't be so close, but they are. They're searching for you.

And then they're ahead of you; flashing lights that make you swerve, sending you down a side road.

The empty road fills with the sound of sirens. Was the bomb not big enough? Or were you too slow? Maybe you should've killed everyone in that bank, or maybe that asshole shouldn't have slashed the goddamn tyres.

A cop leaps from the car, gun in hand and promptly ducks away when Big Jerry fires on him.

You turn to run back, but there's a car there, too.

//Shit.// Three police - four, now - all with guns pointed straight at you.

"DROP THE GUNS!"

"PUT YOUR HANDS IN THE AIR!"

"GET ON THE GROUND"

passages.text:
While you're in prison, you send word out for someone to find and murder Rex. The little shit deserves it, and it brings you a small sense of satisfaction.

You also request Big Jerry's undoing, too. Just for kicks, really.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Hey, have you ever heard of winning?)

passages.name: shoot4
passages.text:

Out front, you see the car, vibrant blue.

The song Hayley switched on is still playing and she's singing into a waterbottle that she throws onto the back seat when you enter her line of sight. Immediately, the engine revs and she's ready as you leap into the car.

She reverses down the street, turning suddenly onto another road and flooring it past the traffic.

She makes good time before the sirens get close. They were distant for so long, distracted by the explosion, but now they're chasing you, and she brakes hard as you come to the end of a long line of traffic.

passages.name: "OUTTA THE CAR", YOU SAY
passages.text:
You run down the street, gun in one hand, bag in the other. The traffic spreads along the road to where you can see a traffic light, currently bright red.

The sirens are gaining.

"That one!" Hayley shouts, pointing towards the first car in the line up. It's green, no where near as fast as the Merc Hayley had lovingly chosen.

At the car, you bang on the window with your gun and force the driver from the car. Hayley leaps into the driver's seat and you follow Big Jerry into the back.

The light turns amber.

Hayley is tuning the radio.

"Move!" you yell, but it's no use.

The light changes to green, and you watch out of the back window as policemen run along the road, guns drawn.

"O'RYAN," you shout.

The radio keeps tuning.

[[SHOOT THE COPS THROUGH THE BACK WINDOW]]
[[WAIT FOR HAYLEY]]

links.text: SHOOT THE COPS THROUGH THE BACK WINDOW

destination.name: SHOOT THE COPS THROUGH THE BACK WINDOW

passages.name: anyway
passages.text:

The song Hayley switched on is still playing and she's singing into a waterbottle that she throws onto the back seat when you enter her line of sight. Immediately, the engine revs and she's ready as you leap into the car.

She reverses down the street, turning suddenly onto another road and flooring it past the traffic.

[["OUTTA THE CAR", YOU SAY]]

passages.name: SHOOT THE COPS THROUGH THE BACK WINDOW
passages.text:
You turn, raising your gun and shooting as the radio turns and tunes and spins and the noises cut in and out, separated with static. Glass sprays around and the police duck behind cars.

You lay down a covering fire and Hayley swears as she struggles to find a radio station.

"Just go!" Big Jerry yells. 

The light is green. 

The police are advancing.

You let out another spray of bullets.

"Fine!" Hayley replies, but you can tell that the music's not right. It's not like the song she sent you off to - it's got more of a beat, less anger in the lyrics.

You speed away from the line of traffic, and are met with flashing blue cars on either side, keeping pace as Hayley tries to get ahead. She growls and slams on her brakes, the car lurching back behind the police. Hayley swerves the car away, down another road, but there are cars still behind you. The police are still following.

Hayley lets out a colourful string of curses, and you recognise something familiar: she's lost the faith.

You wish she'd found the right song.

The car makes another corner, between two buildings, but there's a cop car waiting there, police with their guns drawn. Hayley starts to reverse as they park behind you, too.

[[SHIT]]

passages.name: WAIT FOR HAYLEY
passages.text:
The police get closer.

The radio turns over.

Big Jerry's swearing gets louder.

[[AND THEN THE GUITARS CRASH THROUGH THE SPEAKERS]]

links.text: AND THEN THE GUITARS CRASH THROUGH THE SPEAKERS

destination.name: AND THEN THE GUITARS CRASH THROUGH THE SPEAKERS

passages.name: SHIT
passages.text:
You are arrested with your accomplices.

[[STATS->stats11]]

passages.name: stats11
passages.text:
BANK: UNSUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: FAILED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: THREE

[[AFTERMATH->aftermath10]]

passages.name: aftermath10
passages.text:
You read the newspaper in prison. It burns you up a little inside that Francis wasn't caught when the rest of you were. You organise a meeting to rat him out in exchange for a shorter sentence.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(You can do better than this.)

passages.name: AND THEN THE GUITARS CRASH THROUGH THE SPEAKERS
passages.text:
Hayley is a devil in the streets.

She's a storm and a typhoon and a tsunami.

You can't even keep track of where you're headed with her at the wheel.

[[THE SINGER IS DROWNED OUT BY THEIR MUSICIANS]]

links.text: THE SINGER IS DROWNED OUT BY THEIR MUSICIANS

destination.name: THE SINGER IS DROWNED OUT BY THEIR MUSICIANS

passages.name: THE SINGER IS DROWNED OUT BY THEIR MUSICIANS
passages.text:
At a multi-storey car park, you switch cars and Big Jerry takes the wheel.

Hayley relaxes in the back of the car.

[[THE ROAD IS WIDE OPEN AHEAD OF YOU]]

links.text: THE ROAD IS WIDE OPEN AHEAD OF YOU

destination.name: THE ROAD IS WIDE OPEN AHEAD OF YOU

passages.name: THE ROAD IS WIDE OPEN AHEAD OF YOU
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: SUCCEEDED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: THREE

[[CONGRATS->congrats4]]

passages.name: congrats4
passages.text:
Winning feels good. So does spending the money.

There are other banks out there, you figure.

More money for you.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Good job, I suppose)

passages.name: shoot5
passages.text:
She drops to the follow and now you have everyone's attention.

"This is a robbery!" You announce, turning and waving your gun around. "Please remain calm and we won't have to kill you!" You look to the remaining cashier, who's quivering where she stands. "Money. Bag. Now."

She starts unloading notes into the bag and you watch, smiling.

Big Jerry totes his gun around the room as he looks over the customers, occasionally taking their jewellery or, in some cases, the money from their bags.

"Wonderful," you say, taking the bag when she's done.

Then you shoot her.

[["HEY!" SOMEONE SHOUTS->hey3]]

passages.name: vio3
passages.text:
You nod to Big Jerry, who shoots her. Her body drops.

"This is a robbery!" You announce, turning and waving your gun around. "Please remain calm and we won't have to kill you!" You look to the remaining cashier, who's quivering where she stands. "Money. Bag. Now."

She starts unloading notes into the bag and you watch, smiling.

Big Jerry totes his gun around the room as he looks over the customers, occasionally taking their jewellery or, in some cases, the money from their bags.

"Wonderful," you say, taking the bag when she's done.

Then you shoot her.

[["HEY!" SOMEONE SHOUTS->hey3]]

passages.name: hey3
passages.text:
You turn, finding the security guard standing with his baton out in the doorway.

You don't see a gun.

[[SHOOT HIM->shoot9]]
[[SHOOT A HOSTAGE AS A POWER MOVE->hostage2]]

links.text: SHOOT A HOSTAGE AS A POWER MOVE

passages.name: hostage2
passages.text:
You shoot the nearest civilian and she screams, blood spurting from a fresh wound. She falls to her knees and someone bends down to help her.

"Don't move," Big Jerry says. "Or the next one's going in you."

They freeze and you turn back to the guard.

"Or," you say, "the next bullet could go in you. Out the way."

He pauses before going slack. He moves aside.

You and Big Jerry head for the door.

[[SHOOT THE GUARD ANYWAY->anyway2]]

passages.name: shoot9
passages.text:
Big Jerry shoots the guard and you watch him fall to the ground. He's still alive, wailing and squirming.

As you pass him, towards the door, you consider sending a bullet into his head, but decide against it. Then you keep going.

Outside, a Black McLaren pulls up in front of you, "Orange" not even sparing you a glance as you climb in. The wheels squeal and the car races off down the street. You check the money in the bag as "Orange" drives, counting it up in your head. There's not as much as you'd hoped for.

Why didn't you go into the vault? It was always there, on your plan - but you decided against it. Big Jerry had said that going into the vault would be riskier, even with the bomb.

In fact, splitting this amount of money four ways... it's almost not even worth robbing the bank in the first place.

An idea pops into your head.

[[SHOOT BIG JERRY->shootjerry]]
[[DON'T SHOOT HIM]]

passages.name: anyway2
passages.text:
Outside, a Black McLaren pulls up in front of you, "Orange" not even sparing you a glance as you climb in. The wheels squeal and the car races off down the street. You check the money in the bag as "Orange" drives, counting it up in your head. There's not as much as you'd hoped for.

Why didn't you go into the vault? It was always there, on your plan - but you decided against it. Big Jerry had said that going into the vault would be riskier, even with the bomb.

In fact, splitting this amount of money four ways... it's almost not even worth robbing the bank in the first place.

An idea pops into your head.

[[SHOOT BIG JERRY->shootjerry]]
[[DON'T SHOOT HIM]]

passages.name: DON'T SHOOT HIM
passages.text:
The sirens start heading towards you eventually, but you've had a head start - one long enough fro "Orange" to put a considerable distance between you and the cops.

You switch cars when you need to, but it all feels a little worthless. There's barely enough money in the haul to split.

You get away with the robbery, but no one's happy when you dish out the money.

[[STATS->stats12]]

passages.name: shootjerry
passages.text:
The gunshot sounds before you even know what you're doing. There's shock in Big Jerry's eyes and he reaches for his weapon.

You shoot him again.

And again.

And once more for luck.

"Orange" looks away from the road, wide-eyed.

"What the hell," he says, the only words you've ever heard him say. You're probably more shocked than he is.

[["DON'T WORRY," YOU SAY. "JUST KEEP DRIVING."]]

passages.name: "DON'T WORRY," YOU SAY. "JUST KEEP DRIVING."
passages.text:
You pose a further idea to "Orange", as he drives.

"What if we get rid of Ezikiel, too?"

"Orange" doesn't take his eyes from the road.

"A fifty-fifty split might be worth doing. If we don't, this will've been the worst robbery known to man. We barely got anything."

"Orange" looks over to you. Almost imperceptibly, he nods.

[[STATS->stats13]]

passages.name: stats12
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: THREE

[[CONGRATS, I GUESS]]

passages.name: CONGRATS, I GUESS
passages.text:
You have to listen to Big Jerry and Francis bitch about their cuts for a solid hour before they leave you alone. "Orange" just gives you the middle finger and steals a lamp from the office when he goes.

Your cut might just about cover groceries for a month.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Victory never tasted so crap, huh?)

passages.name: stats13
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: ONE

[[CONGRATS->congrats5]]

passages.name: congrats5
passages.text:
You know where Francis is hiding out after the explosion. You find a payphone, make an anonymous call to the police and leave straight after.

The next day, Francis Ezikiel's face is plastered over the front pages of all the papers after being arrested for the bomb.

"Orange" almost smiles, but doesn't, when he takes his cut of the money.

You do, though. You smile and watch the McLaren, Big Jerry's body still inside, crumple inside the car crusher.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Let's not betray your buddies next time, okay?)

passages.name: vault3
passages.text:
You point your pistol at the nearest cashier, storming towards them. She's young, terrified, with her hands raised in surrender.

"Vault," you say. "Take me there."

You tell Big Jerry to look after the hostages and, keeping your pistol raised, follow the cashier through, her shaking the whole way.

At the first door, she says, "I need to put in a code."

"Go on."

She presses at the buttons until a light turns green and you're through the first door, heading back into an office area where you lodge the barrel of the gun into the small of her back to force her forward.

"Okay, okay." She takes you through another door and down a flight of stairs until you're faced with a circular door of steel. A keypad and card reader on the right, and a locking wheel in the centre of the door.

She looks to you for confirmation and you shove her forward. She presses in a code, swipes her card and turns the wheel.

[[THE VAULT OPENS->opens3]]

passages.name: tills1
passages.text:
You point your pistol at the nearest cashier, storming towards them. She's young, terrified, with her hands raised in surrender.

The other is crouched on the floor, quivering.

"Money," you say. "Hand it over. Now."

She hesitates, and then starts piling the money into your bag.

"Not the bottom ones," you say. You know that trick.

She does as she's told, and a moment later, you're heading back out to the street, Randall taking the gun you hand him as you go.

[[YOU'RE OUTTA HERE->outta11]]

[[YOU'RE OUTTA HERE->outta12]]

passages.name: opens3
passages.text:
Past the door there's a small room, grey in colour.

In the centre is a metallic pallet, piled high with clean, new bank notes.

You take one more look at the cashier and send a bullet flying through her gut, then you scramble to fill your bag with the money.

Upstairs, the hostages are lying on the floor, still shaking and crying and pleading quietly.

You head straight past them, to where Big Jerry stands with his semi-automatic. Randall Staunton, now finished distracting the guard, stands next to him, toting a gun from your suitcase.

Faintly, in the distance, you can hear the sirens of the police, copping onto the robbery. There must've been a silent alarm somewhere. Or maybe someone outside phoned.

Either way,

[[YOU'RE OUTTA HERE->outta8]]

passages.name: opens4
passages.text:

In the centre is a metallic pallet, piled high with clean, new bank notes.

Either way,

[[YOU'RE OUTTA HERE->outta9]]

passages.name: outta8
passages.text:
Out on the street, though, Rex and his red BMW are nowhere to be seen.

"He's ditched us," Big Jerry growls.

"This is your fault," you tell him.

[[RUN WHILE YOU STILL CAN]]

passages.name: opens6
passages.text:
Past the door there's a small room, grey in colour.

In the centre is a metallic pallet, piled high with clean, new bank notes.

You take one more look at the cashier and send a bullet flying through her gut, then you scramble to fill your bag with the money.

Either way,

[[YOU'RE OUTTA HERE->outta10]]

passages.name: outta10
passages.text:
Out on the street, though, "Orange" and his black McLaren are nowhere to be seen.

"He ditched us," you growl.

"Asshole" Big Jerry says. "Why'd you bring up the last job, anyway?"

[[RUN WHILE YOU STILL CAN]]

passages.name: outta9
passages.text:
Out on the street, though, Hayley and her blue Mercedes are nowhere to be seen.

"She ditched us," you growl.

"This is your fault," Big Jerry says. "You shoulda let her do her stupid music thing."

[[RUN WHILE YOU STILL CAN]]

passages.name: outta11
passages.text:
Out on the street, though, Rex and his red BMW are nowhere to be seen.

"He's ditched us," Big Jerry growls.

"This is your fault," you tell him.

[[RUN WHILE YOU STILL CAN]]

passages.text:
