"She ditched us," you growl.

"This is your fault," Big Jerry says. "You shoulda let her do her stupid music thing."

[[RUN WHILE YOU STILL CAN]]

passages.name: outta13
passages.text:
Out on the street, though, "Orange" and his black McLaren are nowhere to be seen.

"He ditched us," you growl.

"Asshole" Big Jerry says. "Why'd you bring up the last job, anyway?"

[[RUN WHILE YOU STILL CAN]]

passages.name: RUN WHILE YOU STILL CAN
passages.text:
You run the only direction you can think of: away from the police station, and towards the secondary car you were supposed to switch to.

Big Jerry complains the whole time. Randall curses a lot.

It's very difficult to look inconspicuous while covering your face with a bandana and running through the streets with loaded guns. You don't manage it well.

You keep running and you force yourself to sprint even faster when the sirens start in the distance.

But you're on foot, the cops are in their cars, and traffic is moving too quickly for you to steal anything. So you're just going, tightly gripping your money bag and hoping that you can find a way out of this before you're caught.

But there are the cops, and Big Jerry is spraying them with bullets, and Randall is shoving a woman ahead of him like a human shield, and you duck behind a car; windows shattering right above your head.

You look at your accomplices.

You look at the woman, caught with bullets before the cops stopped shooting them.

You know your choices. In the end, they're the only two choices you'll ever have.

[[GO DOWN FIGHTING->fighting]]
[[COMPLY WITH THE COPS]]

passages.name: fighting
passages.text:
You are shot before you see the deaths of your friends.

[[STATS->stats14]]

passages.name: COMPLY WITH THE COPS
passages.text:
You and your accomplices are arrested.

[[STATS->stats15]]

passages.name: stats14
passages.text:
BANK: UNSUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: FAILED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: TWO

[[AFTERMATH->aftermath11]]

passages.name: stats15
passages.text:
BANK: UNSUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: FAILED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: TWO

[[AFTERMATH->aftermath12]]

passages.name: aftermath11
passages.text:
No one comes to your funeral, but you don't know that.

No one goes to Big Jerry's and Randall's either, though.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
('They All Die In The End' is a cop-out ending)

passages.name: aftermath12
passages.text:
From prison, you send out your remaining people to make your ex-getaway driver's life a living hell. They deserve it, that fucker.

In prison, though, the food isn't all that bad and you get two hours of TV time a day. Maybe you should've come here earlier.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(There's an 'Everyone Dies At The End' ending out there, if you want it)

passages.name: THE VAULT
passages.text:
The vault is through a series of doors and down a flight of stairs, where a circular door of steel stands, opposing and silent. You prod forward the cashier with your gun, and with a shaking hand she types in the numbers to the keypad, swipes her card across the card reader and pulls on the wheel in the centre of the door until it swings open.

Inside is a grey room, with a large stack of notes piled up in the centre.

"BOSS!" Amy's voice calls from up the stairs. "Police are here!"

They're early. You expected to have more time.

[[SHOOT THE CASHIER AND GRAB THE MONEY]]

links.text: SHOOT THE CASHIER AND GRAB THE MONEY

destination.name: SHOOT THE CASHIER AND GRAB THE MONEY

passages.name: SHOOT THE CASHIER AND GRAB THE MONEY
passages.text:
Back upstairs, your bag heavy with cash, you hide behind the counter with Amy.

The Destroyer is closer to the doors, still out of sight from the outside, but with a good angle on the door, should the police come inside.

"We claimed we have hostages," Amy tells you. It's a bold lie, considering there are twenty bodies dead on the floor.

"Is Rex still outside?" you ask.

Amy nods. "Waiting on us."

[[OKAY PLAN B]]

passages.name: OKAY PLAN B
passages.text:
"Let's wait it out a bit longer," you say. "Destroyer-"

"//The// Destroyer," he corrects.

"The Destroyer, signal Rex. Bring the car to us."

The Destroyer moves from his crouch, rolls across the ground and makes his way to the window. He ducks in and out, trying to catch Rex's attention. After whistling and knocking lightly on the glass, it's clear that Rex hasn't seen any of it.

The Destroyer pulls out his burner phone, rolling his eyes.

He dials and presses the phone to his ear. "Bring the car to us," he says, then hangs up and ducks back to where you're standing.

A minute passes before a police car smashes through the front window of Richman's Circle, and the shouts from outside begin.

[[TO THE CAR]]

passages.name: TO THE CAR
passages.text:
In the front seat of the cop car, Rex smirks.

You leap into the car, ducking down as far as you can go as the gun fire begins on the police car. Rex reverses the car out of the building, hitting someone in the process, and slams his foot down on the accelerator.

He drives you down the pavement, pedestrians jumping aside, before sending you onto the road and squealing away from the police, now rushing to their cars.

He swerves violently and recklessly around corners, taking the turns wide and fast - weaving in and out of traffic and heading away from main roads before turning back onto them.

Traffic begins to get worse, and he doesn't even hesitate before reaching over and switching on the sirens.

The bullet-riddled car screams and flashes blue, and traffic moves aside for it, creating a path for him to fly through.

He doesn't look phased when we come upon a police blockade - just swerves suddenly to the right and keeps on going.

[[YOU HAVE A DAMN GOOD DRIVER]]

links.text: YOU HAVE A DAMN GOOD DRIVER

destination.name: YOU HAVE A DAMN GOOD DRIVER

passages.name: YOU HAVE A DAMN GOOD DRIVER
passages.text:
After switching cars somewhere along the line, you have time to think, driving the car with Rex in the passenger seat, chewing gum and listening to music on his headphones.

Amy was no help in this heist and The Destroyer...

The Destroyer killed everyone. There are very different sentences in prison for bank robbers and mass murderers - and there are very different amounts of resources that police use for catching the two.

There are decisions to be made, and that bag of money at Rex's feet is involved in it.

[[KILL AMY - SHE'S USELESS]]
[[KILL THE DESTROYER - HE COULD'VE KILLED YOU]]
[[KILL REX - WHY NOT]]
[[KILL NO ONE]]

links.text: KILL THE DESTROYER - HE COULD'VE KILLED YOU

destination.name: KILL THE DESTROYER - HE COULD'VE KILLED YOU

passages.name: KILL AMY - SHE'S USELESS
passages.text:
As Amy climbs out of the car, you shoot her through the side of the head. She's dead before she hits the ground.

[[KILL THE DETROYER TOO]]
[[THAT'S ENOUGH]]

passages.name: KILL THE DESTROYER - HE COULD'VE KILLED YOU
passages.text:
As The Destroyer climbs out of the car, when you're finally safe, you shoot him three times in the back of the head. Faster than he's able to draw his weapon.

[[KILL AMY - FINISH THE JOB]] 
[[THAT'S ENOUGH KILLING]]

passages.name: KILL REX - WHY NOT
passages.text:
You consider it for a second, and then you realise that's a stupid thing to do and don't.

Why would you want to hurt Rex?

[[KILL AMY - SHE'S USELESS]] 
[[KILL THE DESTROYER - HE COULD'VE KILLED YOU]]

links.text: KILL THE DESTROYER - HE COULD'VE KILLED YOU

destination.name: KILL THE DESTROYER - HE COULD'VE KILLED YOU

passages.name: KILL NO ONE
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: THREE

[[CONGRATS->congrats6]]

passages.name: congrats6
passages.text:
You split the money up evenly and go your separate ways.

During the next job, you don't call Amy.

And you don't call The Destroyer unless you know you're going to be in for a fire fight.

You, do, however, call Rex, because he's a damn good driver with access to very pretty cars.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(There are endings where Rex dies. Please don't find them)

passages.name: THAT'S ENOUGH KILLING
passages.text:
Amy and Rex stare at you in shock.

You lift the bag.

"Three way split?" you suggest.

[[STATS->stats17]]

passages.name: KILL AMY - FINISH THE JOB
passages.text:
As Amy turns around, shocked, you shoot her over the roof of the car. Her face disappears behind the gore.

Rex ducks behind the car, weaponless.

"Don't worry," you say, "I'm not gonna shoot you - not when you can drive like that."

Hesitant, he reappears.

"You sure?" he asks.

You smile and raise the money bag so he can see.

"Swear on our prize money."

[[STATS->stats16]]

passages.name: stats16
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: ONE

[[CONGRATS->congrats8]]

passages.name: stats17
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: TWO

[[CONGRATS->congrats7]]

passages.name: KILL THE DETROYER TOO
passages.text:
You should've shot The Destroyer first and you realise it too late.

As your body turns to point the gun at him, his weapon is already raised, finger on the trigger, and miniature explosions sound from his gun.

You get one shot off before three puncture your skin.

[[STATS->stats19]]

passages.name: THAT'S ENOUGH
passages.text:
The Destroyer's weapon is on you in a heartbeat and you raise your hands in surrender.

"No point keeping her around," you tell him. "Anyway, that's a bigger cut for the rest of us."

[[STATS->stats18]]

passages.name: stats18
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: TWO

[[CONGRATS->congrats9]]

passages.name: stats19
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: WELL, YOU'RE DEAD, SO????? ONE? MAYBE?

[[AFTERMATH->aftermath18]]

passages.name: congrats7
passages.text:
The Destroyer wraps Amy's body in plastic, ties weights around her legs and drops her into the river.

You just watch.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Wow, you betrayed your collegues? That's not nice)

passages.name: congrats8
passages.text:
Rex drives for you every now and again, but you can tell his wary. Maybe it makes him work harder, maybe it makes him afraid of you - but either way, you're still raking in the cash, and neither of you have to worry about rent money ever again.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(You can do better than killing all your partners)

passages.name: congrats9
passages.text:
You have to find a new diversion for your jobs, but you don't mind too much. The Destroyer knows a guy who likes blowing things up and doesn't care about people's lives - which, really is on par for the sort of friends you imagine he'd have.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Hey let's not kill Amy again okay she's cool)

passages.name: aftermath18
passages.text:
As a ghost, you watch as The Destroyer gives Rex five percent of the money and walks off into the night.

As a ghost, you haunt the fuck out of The Destroyer's apartment and knock everything he owns off his shelves.

As a ghost, you occasionally write encouraging messages on Rex's steamed-up mirror and smile as he whispers his thanks to "the ghost living in his appartment".

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(This is secret ghost ending)

passages.name: vault6
passages.text:
The vault is through a series of doors and down a flight of stairs, where a circular door of steel stands, opposing and silent. You prod forward the cashier with your gun, and with a shaking hand she types in the numbers to the keypad, swipes her card across the card reader and pulls on the wheel in the centre of the door until it swings open.

Inside is a grey room, with a large stack of notes piled up in the centre.

"BOSS!" Amy's voice calls from up the stairs. "Police are here!"

They're early. You expected to have more time.

[[SHOOT THE CASHIER AND GRAB THE MONEY->monayy]]

links.text: SHOOT THE CASHIER AND GRAB THE MONEY

passages.name: monayy
passages.text:
Back upstairs, your bag heavy with cash, you hide behind the counter with Amy.

The Destroyer is closer to the doors, still out of sight from the outside, but with a good angle on the door, should the police come inside.

"We claimed we have hostages," Amy tells you. It's a bold lie, considering there are twenty bodies dead on the floor.

"Is Hayley still outside?" you ask.

Amy nods. "Waiting on us."

[[FINE PLAN B]]

passages.name: FINE PLAN B
passages.text:
"Let's wait it out a bit longer," you say. "Destroyer-"

"//The// Destroyer," he corrects.

"The Destroyer, call Hayley. Bring the car to us."

The Destroyer pulls out his burner phone.

He dials and presses the phone to his ear. "Bring the car to us," he says, then hangs up.

Only a few seconds pass before the sound of guitars hits your ears. Following it is a bright blue Mercedes smashing through the front window of Richman's Circle.

[[TO THE CAR->car]]

passages.name: car
passages.text:
You leap into the car, ducking down as far as you can go as the gun fire begins on the Mercedes. Hayley reverses the car out of the building, hitting someone in the process, and slams her foot down on the accelerator.

She drives you down the pavement, pedestrians jumping aside, before sending you onto the road and squealing away from the police, now rushing to their cars.

She swerves violently and recklessly around corners, taking the turns wide and fast - weaving in and out of traffic and heading away from main roads before turning back onto them.

Eventually, she's far enough ahead that she ducks the Merc into a side street and backs out of sight. You're silent as the sirens speed right past us, and when they're gone, Hayley heads back out onto the road in the other direction.

[[YOU HAVE A DAMN GOOD DRIVER->babydriver]]

links.text: YOU HAVE A DAMN GOOD DRIVER

passages.name: babydriver
passages.text:
After switching cars somewhere along the line, you have time to think, driving the car with Hayley in the passenger seat, tapping her foot to the music on the radio.

In the back, The Destroyer and Amy bicker about something. You think it might be politics - but Amy's getting riled up and The Destroyer is smirking like this means he's winning. You look over to Hayley, and she meets your eye for a moment.

You give a small nod to the people in the back seat, and she takes the gun from the cupholder you shoved it in. Your other one is still sitting neatly in your lap. She holds it casually, like she's just looking, but it's an answer. It's an answer you didn't expect from Hayley - you assumed she'd oppose it.

Eventually, you park the car.

The four of you climb out.

[[SHOOT THE DESTROYER]]
[[DON'T SHOOT HIM->betrayal]]

passages.name: SHOOT THE DESTROYER
passages.text:
You get a shot off before he has a chance to react. You send another into his skull, just in case.

At the same moment, Hayley shoots Amy in the head, and the two fall down in tandem, their bodies crumpling to the floor.

You look over a Hayley, half wary, but she lowers the gun.

"I don't know how to dispose of bodies," she tells you.

"Don't worry," you reply, "I'll teach you."

[[STATS->stats20]]

passages.name: betrayal
passages.text:
As you climb out of the car, you consider shooting The Destroyer in the back of the head. But, like the flick of a switch, you decide not to.

You don't have time to tell Hayley.

Before you're fully out of the car, there's a bang and Amy's head is more gore than anything else and she's falling to her knees. Hayley looks over to you, and you catch too many emotions in her eyes. Shock, betrayal, confusion.

The Destroyer's gun is raised on her in a second and she freezes.

"What the hell was that?" he demands.

Hayley stutters for words and looks at you, desperation in her eyes.

[[HELP HER OUT]]
[[LET'S NOT]]

passages.name: stats20
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: ONE

[[CONGRATS->congrats10]]

passages.name: HELP HER OUT
passages.text:
"It had to be done," you say before The Destroyer can shoot Hayley. "Amy was a weak link. It's better this way."

Hayley nods, like this was the plan.

"Besides, she didn't come in handy today. Maybe next time she might've, but I can't risk that again. Hayley did what any one of us would do."

Slowly, The Destroyer lowers his gun. "Warn a guy next time."

"Absolutely," you lie.

You figure Hayley will want you to make this up to her some day.

[[STATS->stats21]]

passages.name: LET'S NOT
passages.text:
"What the fuck, O'Ryan?" you cry, pretending to be shocked.

There's shock and rage and hurt in her eyes and for a heartbeat, you feel bad about it.

"You-" she gets out, before a bullet lands itself in her chest. As she stares down at it, surprised, another flies into her forehead.

"I don't like backstabbers," The Destroyer tells you.

It feels a little like a threat, so you nod and heft the money in one hand.

"I thought she was better than that," you tell him.

[[STATS->stats22]]

passages.name: stats21
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: TWO

[[CONGRATS->congrats11]]

passages.name: stats22
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: ONE

[[CONGRATS->congrats12]]

passages.name: congrats10
passages.text:
You show Hayley how to dump a body in a river, and leave one in the boot of a car to be crushed. She takes the lesson on board, and there's an edge to her that you notice, standing in the junk yard - something that wasn't there before.

Maybe next time, she'll carry her own gun.

Or maybe, she'll shoot first.

Or, hopefully, she'll follow you in this game you're playing and you'll have at least one person who's totally loyal.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(You saved her, but you also corrupted her - do better next time)

passages.name: congrats11
passages.text:
She doesn't trust you like you want her to, and she doesn't accept any more jobs from you, either.

Sometimes, jumping into the car at the end of a heist, you're a little worried because it's not her in the driver's seat.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Do better, don't ruin her trust like that)

passages.name: congrats12
passages.text:
You don't tell anyone this, but sometimes when you leave the shower there are threatening notes written in the steam on your mirror and you could've sworn they're written in Hayley's handwriting.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Don't betray Hayley next time, asshole)

passages.name: vault7
passages.text:
The vault is through a series of doors and down a flight of stairs, where a circular door of steel stands, opposing and silent. You prod forward the cashier with your gun, and with a shaking hand she types in the numbers to the keypad, swipes her card across the card reader and pulls on the wheel in the centre of the door until it swings open.

Inside is a grey room, with a large stack of notes piled up in the centre.

"BOSS!" Amy's voice calls from up the stairs. "Police are here!"

They're early. You expected to have more time.

[[SHOOT THE CASHIER AND GRAB THE MONEY->monayyy]]

links.text: SHOOT THE CASHIER AND GRAB THE MONEY

passages.name: monayyy
passages.text:
Back upstairs, your bag heavy with cash, you hide behind the counter with Amy.

The Destroyer is closer to the doors, still out of sight from the outside, but with a good angle on the door, should the police come inside.

"We claimed we have hostages," Amy tells you. It's a bold lie, considering there are twenty bodies dead on the floor.

"Is "Orange" still outside?" you ask.

Amy nods. "Waiting on us."

[[FINE PLAN B->b]]

passages.name: b
passages.text:
"Let's wait it out a bit longer," you say. "Destroyer-"

"//The// Destroyer," he corrects.

"The Destroyer, call "Orange". Bring the car to us."

The Destroyer pulls out his burner phone.

He dials and presses the phone to his ear. "Bring the car to us," he says, then hangs up.

You wait a solid minute before the McLaren crashes through the front window of Richman's Circle. "Orange", blood smeared on his face from what must've been a close shot, just stares at you.

[[TO THE CAR->car2]]

passages.name: car2
passages.text:
You leap into the car, ducking down as far as you can go as the gun fire begins on the McLaren. "Orange" reverses the car out of the building, hitting someone in the process, and slams his foot down on the accelerator.

He drives you down the pavement, pedestrians jumping aside, before sending you onto the road and squealing away from the police, now rushing to their cars.

He swerves violently and recklessly around corners, taking the turns wide and fast - weaving in and out of traffic and heading away from main roads before turning back onto them.

Eventually, he's far enough ahead to skid into a levelled car park, leap out of the car and break into another. He hotwires it in seconds and you're off again in a Ford, as the police search for the McLaren. 

[[YOU HAVE A DAMN GOOD DRIVER->babydriver2]]

links.text: YOU HAVE A DAMN GOOD DRIVER

passages.name: babydriver2
passages.text:
After switching cars again at the scheduled car park, you have time to think, driving the car with "Orange" in the passenger seat, staring blankly ahead.

In the back, The Destroyer and Amy bicker about something. You think it might be politics - but Amy's getting riled up and The Destroyer is smirking like this means he's winning. You look over to "Orange", and he meets your eye for a moment.

You give a small nod to the people in the back seat, and he pulls out his gun. Yours is still sitting neatly in your lap. He holds it casually, like he's just looking, but it's an answer.

Eventually, you park the car.

The four of you climb out.

[[SHOOT THE DESTROYER->killkillkill]]
[[DON'T SHOOT HIM->betrayal2]]

passages.name: killkillkill
passages.text:
You get a shot off before he has a chance to react. You send another into his skull, just in case.

At the same moment, "Orange" shoots Amy in the head, and the two fall down in tandem, their bodies crumpling to the floor.

You look over a "Orange", half wary, but he lowers the gun.

"Good job," you say, lowering yours.

"Orange" nods once, raises his weapon and shoots.

Everything goes black.

[[STATS->stats23]]

passages.name: betrayal2
passages.text:
As you climb out of the car, you consider shooting The Destroyer in the back of the head. But, like the flick of a switch, you decide not to.

You don't have time to tell "Orange".

Before you're fully out of the car, there's a bang and Amy's head is more gore than anything else and she's falling to her knees. "Orange" looks over to you, as if waiting. But you don't move.

The Destroyer's gun is raised on him in a second.

"What the hell was that?" he demands.

"Orange", like always, says nothing.

He looks to you.

[[HELP HIM OUT]]
[[LET'S NOT->nah]]

passages.name: stats23
passages.text:
BANK: UNSUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: FAILED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: ZERO

[[AFTERMATH->aftermath19]]

passages.name: aftermath19
passages.text:
You're dead.

There is no aftermath for you.

I hear "Orange" is doing well, though.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Wow, you have to be a certain brand of terrible to get killed by //"Orange"//)

passages.name: HELP HIM OUT
passages.text:
"Good job, "Orange"," you say before The Destroyer can shoot him. "We were all thinking about doing it. You're the only one with the initiative to do it.

Orange still stares at you. There's no emotion to find on his face.

Slowly, The Destroyer lowers his gun. "Warn a guy next time."

"Absolutely," you lie.

You figure "Orange" will want you to make this up to him. You decide to give him a bigger percentage of the cash. Maybe then he won't murder you in your sleep.

[[STATS->stats24]]

passages.name: nah
passages.text:
"What the fuck?" you cry, pretending to be shocked.

"Orange" looks to you and before anyone has a chance to breathe another breath, he's shooting you.

There's a slice of pain and then you're gone.

[[STATS->stats25]]

passages.name: stats24
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: TWO

[[CONGRATS->congrats13]]

passages.name: congrats13
passages.text:
"Orange" doesn't murder you in your sleep, but he does arrange for some friends of his to beat the shit out of you three nights later.

A week after that, your power goes goes and your water stops working, and you're pretty sure who arranged that.

Then you find a snake in your bed, and you figure you should just move.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(I mean, you succeeedin the robbery, but I wouldn't call this a win)

passages.name: stats25
passages.text:
BANK: UNSUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: FAILED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: ONE

[[AFTERMATH->aftermath20]]

passages.name: aftermath20
passages.text:
Well, you're dead.

And so is "Orange", as he doesn't speak and so didn't have a chance to explain himself to The Destroyer. You know "Orange" is dead because you meet him in Hell. It's not Hell to him, though - that's not in his religion.

I could go on about how "Orange"'s perception of the afterlife is different to yours, despite you both acknowledging each other's presence in these individual places you're occupying at the same time, but that's unimportant.

Also, The Destroyer took all the cash.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(There are better endings than the Hell ending)

passages.name: "TAKE THEIR JEWELLERY, WATCHES - WHATEVER"
passages.text:
The Destroyer makes his way around the room, tugging off bracelets, necklaces, rings. He takes watches, too; stuffing them in the pockets of his trenchcoat and in the suitcase.

The cashier finishes with the cash, and you yank the bag away.

Two minutes left, not bad.

[[HEAD FOR THE CAR]]

passages.name: HEAD FOR THE CAR
passages.text:
Outside, people only panic when they see the guns. You don't hear any sirens yet, but a guard from a nearby store does take a bullet to the gut from The Destroyer when they ask you to stop.

That makes people scream.

Rex gets you away from them, fast. He speeds down the streets, away from the detonation target. With less than fifteen seconds before the bomb is due to go off, Rex spins the car into a side alley.

"You sure about this?" he asks.

[[YES - PLAN A'S A WINNER]]
[[OKAY, NO, LET'S DO PLAN B]]

links.text: OKAY, NO, LET'S DO PLAN B

destination.name: OKAY, NO, LET'S DO PLAN B

passages.name: YES - PLAN A'S A WINNER
passages.text:
"Trust me," you reply, so Rex parks the car and you all jump out, rushing down the alley to where an inconspicuous Corsa Excite is parked. Out of all the cars you've ever seen, it's the least Exciting.

You jump into the Corsa and start off, driving at the speed limit, bandanas now hidden. You try to look as casual as possible, sitting in the car, and just as you pull out onto the main road, you can hear the distant thud of an explosion.

It's far away from you and you have a head start on your escape.

You let out a breath and Rex keeps driving as if you didn't have the money in your hands. When police cars pass you, sirens wailing - and they do, many of them - you try not to look concerned, and Rex doesn't speed up, but pulls to the side to let them pass.

One by one, they pass you, searching for a bomber, not a bank robber.

[[STATS->stats26]]

passages.name: OKAY, NO, LET'S DO PLAN B
passages.text:
"Change of plans," you say suddenly. "Stick with this car. Get us the fuck outta here."

"You got it, boss," Rex replies, revving the engine and speeding off down the road.

Cars swerve to avoid you and you hold on tight to the money in your lap. Fifteen seconds later, you hear the explosion, far away. The sirens start up almost immediately after and Rex slams his foot on the accelerator to get away from them.

Maybe they wouldn't have noticed you in the slower car you were going to change to - but maybe they would've. And now you've got three cars on your ass and Rex is swearing under his breath as he drives.

You catch sight of a side road coming up. You know there's an exit - you could lose the cops on the sharp bend.

[["THERE!"]]
[[SAY NOTHING]]

passages.name: stats26
passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: THREE

[[CONGRATS->congrats14]]

passages.name: "THERE!"
passages.text:
You point and Rex nods, swerving so suddenly that you hit the door, the air knocked from your lungs. He's doing everything he can to aim the car for the road, but it's not enough.

You're going too fast.

You see the wall race up to meet you and then you see nothing at all.

[[STATS->stats27]]

passages.name: SAY NOTHING
passages.text:
Rex keeps driving and the road passes you by. You keep going but it's not enough - the roads are too packed for the speed Rex is driving at, and the police cars are growing in number.

Up ahead, you can see a new group of flashing lights.

Rex skids to a halt to avoid crashing.

[[STATS->stats28]]

passages.name: stats27
passages.text:
BANK: UNSUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: FAILED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: THREE - BUT YOU'RE DEAD, SO CAN YOU EVEN HAVE ACCOMPLICES ANYMORE?

[[AFTERMATH->aftermath21]]

passages.name: stats28
passages.text:
BANK: UNSUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: FAILED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: THREE

[[AFTERMATH->aftermath22]]

passages.name: congrats14
passages.text:
After ditching the non-exciting Corsa Excite, you all go your separate ways.

You watch the news report - the bombing linked immediately with the robbery, but there being no arrests, let alone any suspects.

You smile, and start planning.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Woop-de-doo)

passages.name: aftermath21
passages.text:
Well, I mean, you're dead, so is there really an aftermath for you?

Your coffin is cheaply made and no one comes to your funeral. Your name is spelled incorrectly on your gravestone.

The gravedigger loses his watch while burying you, so you have to be unburied and then reburied again - and still, no one comes to say goodbye.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Wow you have no friends, that's depressing)

passages.name: aftermath22
passages.text:
You and your accomplices are arrested, including Francis the bomb-guy, because if you're going down, you might as well take everyone with you.

You don't like the prison food and you wish you have more TV hours than you're given.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Crime never pays, or something like that)

passages.name: jewellery
passages.text:
The Destroyer makes his way around the room, tugging off bracelets, necklaces, rings. He takes watches, too; stuffing them in the pockets of his trenchcoat and in the suitcase.

The cashier finishes with the cash, and you yank the bag away.

Two minutes left, not bad.

[[HEAD FOR THE CAR->car123456]]

passages.name: car123456
passages.text:
Outside, people only panic when they see the guns. You don't hear any sirens yet, but a guard from a nearby store does take a bullet to the gut from The Destroyer when they ask you to stop.

That makes people scream.

In the car, though, Hayley doesn't get you away from them. She instead sits, turning the dials of the stereo, a frown painted across her face.

"What are you doing?" The Destroyer yells from the back seat.

"Wait a minute," Hayley mutters.

"We don't have a minute!"

You check your watch. You have a minute a forty-three, forty-two, forty-one.

"Get us out of here!" you shout. "That's an order!"

Growling, Hayley switches off the stereo altogether. No music is better than the wrong music.

[[YOU'RE OUTTA HERE->outtta]]

passages.name: outtta
passages.text:
Hayley's trying and you can tell, but there's something not right with her - like she's been thrown off her game and she can't seem to get it back.

At the corners, she's clumsy.

Passing traffic, she's slow.

[[AT THE SOUND OF THE EXPLOSION, SHE JUMPS]]

links.text: AT THE SOUND OF THE EXPLOSION, SHE JUMPS

destination.name: AT THE SOUND OF THE EXPLOSION, SHE JUMPS

passages.name: AT THE SOUND OF THE EXPLOSION, SHE JUMPS
passages.text:
It echoes in the distance, but the police were already on your tail.

You watch, wide-eyed in the rearview mirror, as the flashing blue lights appear in the distance, not turning towards the bomb.

You have little options now.

[[LET HAYLEY DRIVE]]
[[TRY TO FIND THE RIGHT SONG]]

links.text: TRY TO FIND THE RIGHT SONG

destination.name: TRY TO FIND THE RIGHT SONG

passages.name: LET HAYLEY DRIVE
passages.text:
You let her drive. She's a good driver; you've seen her race, seen the fire that usually burns in her eyes and spreads through her fingertips, engulfing the car in glames. She just doesn't have that about her today.

Surely, it'll be okay.

But the police gain faster than you expected, and Hayley skids to a stop, having not seen the line of traffic ahead.

She swears and slams her hand against the steering wheel before reversing to turn.

But it's too late.

The cop cars at stopping and the police are jumping out, guns loaded.

The Destroyer makes a sound familiar to a roar.

[[YOU'RE ARRESTED WITH YOUR ACCOMPLICES]]

passages.name: TRY TO FIND THE RIGHT SONG
passages.text:
Reaching over to the stereo, you flick it on.

"What are you doing?" The Destroyer and Hayley ask in tandem.

You don't reply, just tune through the stations, letting each one play for a snippet before changing to the next. Advert, weather, talk show, ballad. None of this is car chase music and you're throwing Hayley off more than you're helping her.

"Stop it!" she complains, trying to bat your hand away.

But the damage is done, and Hayley swerves suddenly, trying to catch a side road and missing by a hair. There's anger in her, you can tell - she's pissed and she's over it all, so she faces the police that are following you head on and slams her foot onto the accelerator.

The car speeds towards the cop cars and you scream, The Destroyer yells, and at the last moment she changes course, turning past them, against the flow of traffic.

It was a good move, throwing them off as well as you, but it wasn't enough.

More police file in ahead, and driving against the traffic slows Hayley to a halt.

[[YOU'RE ARRESTED WITH YOUR ACCOMPLICES]]

passages.name: YOU'RE ARRESTED WITH YOUR ACCOMPLICES
passages.text:
BANK: UNSUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: FAILED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: THREE

[[AFTERMATH->aftermath25]]

passages.name: aftermath25
passages.text:
You rat out Francis Ezikiel for a lower sentence.

A scrawny man with a good right hook threatens you in your cell in the middle of the night with a filed toothbrush. He said you should watch your back for having Ezikiel put away.

The next day, you call on one of your prison rats to murder Francis Ezikiel while he sleeps.

You hear it went well.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(Please note: Hayley is precious about her music)

passages.name: "CAMERAS, PEOPLE - NO WITNESSES"
passages.text:
As the cashier piles the money into the bag, gun shots ring out over and over and over. People scream, cry, run - they try to dart for the entrance and are caught in the back by The Destroyer's expert precision. 

It's a blood bath, and you watch, marvelling at his work.

When the cashier is finished, you take the bag from her hands.

"Much appreciated," you say, before shooting her in the head. Might as well do some of the work yourself.

Just less than two minutes left before the explosion. You reach down and pick up the sparkling necklace from the body of one of the victims.

[[HEAD FOR THE CAR->car123457]]

passages.name: car123457
passages.text:
Inside the car, "Orange" watches you both carefully. He's like that; an eye on everything.

You clamber in and he speeds off immediately.

"Well, that went well," you say, rifling through the money. You're careful about it, knowing the tricks and finding a small paperclip on the bottom of one of the notes. It has an edge to it, like there's something more there - so you shake your head and throw the paperclip out the window. You don't have time to deal with trackers.

"I think we should've gone for the vault," The Destroyer says from the back seat.

"If we went for the vault, we wouldn't be out before the bomb," you reply. "We need the extra time to get away."

As you say this, "Orange" turns a corner, and you notice, for the first time, that he's not headed out towards the switch car. It would be like him to take a convoluted route - but this seems to be heading towards the bomb target.

Just as you think this, the explosion sounds.

[[YOU WATCH THE FRONT OF A BUILDING BURST OPEN WITH FIRE]]

links.text: YOU WATCH THE FRONT OF A BUILDING BURST OPEN WITH FIRE

destination.name: YOU WATCH THE FRONT OF A BUILDING BURST OPEN WITH FIRE

passages.name: YOU WATCH THE FRONT OF A BUILDING BURST OPEN WITH FIRE
passages.text:
You jump back, ready to turn on "Orange" and swear - but out the window there's a familiar face, hood up, jogging through the sprinting crowds.

Francis Ezikiel: a man with an affinity for explosives.

"Orange" stops the car nearby and waves to Ezikiel. This isn't part of the plan.

Ezikiel hesitates out in the street before climbing into the car.

"I was gonna take the bus," he says. "This ain't part of the plan."

"No," you mutter, "it isn't."

"Orange" drives slow through the halted traffic and your heart thumps loud in your chest. The sirens sound over the screaming, blue flashing lights appearing a moment later. "Orange" speeds up - is this too obvious? You swallow tight and stare out the front window and "Orange" skids the car to a halt directly in front of the police car.

"What the f-"

The words are almost out when "Orange" slams the door shut behind him, darting away into the crowd. The Destroyer leans over Ezikiel, firing bullets towards "Orange's" retreating body - you're sure you see him stumble from a hit.

The police approach your car with their guns raised, and with no one in the driver's seat, you slowly raise your hands.

[[YOU ARE ARRESTED WITH YOUR ACCOMPLICES]]

links.text: YOU ARE ARRESTED WITH YOUR ACCOMPLICES

destination.name: YOU ARE ARRESTED WITH YOUR ACCOMPLICES

passages.name: YOU ARE ARRESTED WITH YOUR ACCOMPLICES
passages.text:
BANK: UNSUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: FAILED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: TWO

[[AFTERMATH->aftermath26]]

passages.name: aftermath26
passages.text:
A fucking snitch, that's what he was.

"Orange" - such a stupid name - had it out for Ezikiel personally. It //was// understandable - Ezikiel's fuckin' racist. But to hurt you - a non-racist, intersectional feminist? You call bullshit.

In prison, facing your charges over the deaths of all the people in the bank - nineteen - and the people who died from the bombing - twenty-six - as well as the robbery and ties with terrorism, you send out your people to search for "Orange".

Only thing is, you don't actually know his name.

Your people come back with someone, probably just to make you happy - you tell them to kill him, but you're certain as you do so that this is not the man you're after.

Loose ends are unforgivable in this business, and you hate it.

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(You achieved: the snitch ending!)

passages.name: NOT TODAY, BUDDY
passages.text:
With one shot, the guard is flat on his back.

Randall sweeps his gun out towards the hostages, and you turn back to the cashiers. They're piling money into the case, but it's not enough for all the effort.

"Vault," you say. "You've got one. Take me there."

The cashiers are quivering, crying.

You take The Destroyer's suitcase, and climb over the counter, shoving the gun towards the nearest cashier.

"Now," you say.

[[TO THE VAULT]]

passages.name: TO THE VAULT
passages.text:
She leads you through doors and down stairs, typing in keycodes and swiping her card as she goes.

Eventually, you reach the vault; a large circular steel door embeded in the wall. She opens it, revealing a grey room with a pile of neatly stacked money in the centre.

You step into the room and, in a scramble, start shoving the money into your case. Hundreds, thousands of pounds passing through your hands. So much of it.

This is the big leagues.

This is what you've been planning for.

Then, there's a sudden pain in your back and the air leaves your lungs. You fall to one knee, and turn around, where the cashier is holding a fire extinguisher ahead of her, ready to hit you again.

[[SHOOT HER->shootttt]]
[[FIGHT HER IN THE HONOURABLE SPORT OF HAND-TO-HAND COMBAT->combattt]]

links.text: FIGHT HER IN THE HONOURABLE SPORT OF HAND-TO-HAND COMBAT

passages.name: shootttt
passages.text:
The blood splatters back at you. The fire extinfuisher drops to the floor and the sound of its clatter echoes.

You finish filling the case and run back upstairs, just in time to see Randall collapse.

[[...WHAT]]

passages.name: combattt
passages.text:
Man, you haven't fought like this in a while. It feels good.

You yank the extinguisher from her feeble grip and throw it to the side, dropping your gun and bag to the floor as you go. You punch her straight in the face and she stumbles back, blood spurting from her nose.

As she steps back, you step forward, into her space, grabbing her hair and slamming her head against the vault's door frame. She goes limp in your hands, unconscious most likely, and you drop her to the floor.

A small part of you wishes she'd been a better fighter. You could do with a challenge - but there's no time for that in this job. You've already spent too long down here.

You finish filling the case and run back up to the bank.

[[THERE, RANDALL IS ON THE FLOOR]]

links.text: THERE, RANDALL IS ON THE FLOOR

destination.name: THERE, RANDALL IS ON THE FLOOR

passages.name: THERE, RANDALL IS ON THE FLOOR
passages.text:
"I didn't do nothin'" The Destroyer says, holding the case in one hand.

"Narcolepsy," you reply with a shrug.

A few more of the clientele are dead, including the woman with the black eye.

"Carry him," you say, taking the case from The Destroyer.

"I won't be able to cover us," The Destroyer replies.

"Carry him with one arm."

It's an order.

You rush out of bank, Randall flung over one shoulder and head towards the car.

[[REX IS ALREADY REVVING THE ENGINE]]

links.text: REX IS ALREADY REVVING THE ENGINE

destination.name: REX IS ALREADY REVVING THE ENGINE

passages.name: ...WHAT
passages.text:
"The fuck?" The Destroyer says, ducking away from Randall as if a sniper had caught him.

"Narcolepsy," you reply, shaking your head.

A few more of the clinetele are dead, including the woman with the black eye. You head through the bank and close the other case, zipping it shut.

"Carry him," you say, hefting the two cases.

"I won't be able to cover us," The Destroyer replies.

"Carry him with one arm."

It's an order.

You rush out of bank, Randall flung over one shoulder and head towards the car.

[[REX IS ALREADY REVVING THE ENGINE]]

links.text: REX IS ALREADY REVVING THE ENGINE

destination.name: REX IS ALREADY REVVING THE ENGINE

passages.name: REX IS ALREADY REVVING THE ENGINE
passages.text:
You leap into the front seat, chucking a suitcase into the back as The Destroyer wrestles Randall's body into the car. Your Muscle is barely even in by the time Rex is speeding away from the pavement.

You check in the back: Randall is a heap strewn across the seats, his head resting uncomfortably on the suitcase.

[[WAKE HIM]]
[[NO, WAIT A SECOND]]

passages.name: WAKE HIM
passages.text:
"Wake him up," you tell The Destroyer, who shoves at Randall until he stirs. "Of all the times to fall asleep."

"Sorry, boss," Randall mutters, clambering into the seat properly. He's thrown to the side when Rex skids around a corner.

"Don't you have medication for that or something?" you ask, but Randall doesn't reply, just moves until the money case is on his lap.

"My throat is sore from al the yelling," he says a moment later as Rex swerves into a 180 spin, spotting the police cars at the end of the road. "Anyone have a throat lozenge?"

The Destroyer punches him in the arm.

"Ow! Jeez, a simple no would've sufficed."

[[REX DRIVES AND RANDALL DOESN'T STOP TALKING]]

links.text: REX DRIVES AND RANDALL DOESN'T STOP TALKING

destination.name: REX DRIVES AND RANDALL DOESN'T STOP TALKING

passages.name: NO, WAIT A SECOND
passages.text:
You look at Randall, asleep, and then you look the gun in The Destroyer's hand.

"Kill him," you say.

"Fucking hell," Rex says. "That's a bit extreme."

"He'll talk if we just leave him."

"Do we have to kill him? What's wrong with just leaving him alive? Why does he have to go?"

You shake your head. "We'll all get bigger cuts if he does."

The Destroyer says: "I'll kill him if you're ordering me to."

Rex says: "How about we not kill the guy?"

[[OKAY REX, YOU'RE RIGHT->WAKE HIM]]
[[KILL RANDALL]]

passages.name: REX DRIVES AND RANDALL DOESN'T STOP TALKING
passages.text:
It's difficult to focus on the road and the police when Randall doesn't shut his mouth once. He just keeps talking and talking and talking and when he stops talking, he's humming and Rex is making his turns harder just for the satisfaction of hearing Randall hit the door.

So you don't fully notice when Rex loses the police - it just happens.

And then you're changing cars in the corner of a secluded car park and Randall is asking "Can I drive?" and everyone else is saying "No" in tandem.

And then The Destroyer is behind the wheel, driving below the speed limit, and you're in the back and just waiting to count the money.

passages.text:
BANK: SUCCESSFULLY ROBBED

ESCAPE: ACHIEVED

ACCOMPLICES AT THE END: THREE

[[CONGRATS->congrats15]]

passages.name: KILL RANDALL
passages.text:
"Do it," you say.

A shot rings out.

Rex doesn't say anything, just keeps on driving.

When the police come, he evades. He swings around corners and ducks into tiny spaces and drives as fast as he can - but it's not enough and you know it. You all know it, especially when the blockade waits for you and the car is trapped, police on all sides.

[[YOU'RE ARRESTED WITH YOUR ACCOMPICES, AND BY GOD TO THEY FIND THE CORPSE IN THE BACK SEAT]]

[[AFTERMATH->aftermath29]]

passages.name: congrats15
passages.text:
You don't ask Randall on another job - you don't think your ears could cope with it.

It's a big cut of money for each of you, and you find yourself lining it up along the kitchen table in equal piles when the message comes through.

//RANDALL IS DEAD//

It's from The Destroyer. You smile.

//I EXPECT AN EQUAL CUT OF HIS MONEY// you reply. //DON'T TELL REX//

[[PLAY AGAIN]]
(I know he talked a lot, but did you have to kill him?)

passages.text:
Prison's not so bad after a while.

You even come to like it.
